title: Withdrawing the United States From and Ending Funding to Certain United Nations Organizations and Reviewing United States Support to All International Organizations

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the United States to withdraw from certain United Nations organizations, specifically the UN Human Rights Council and restrict funding to the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA), due to concerns about anti-Israel bias and security risks. It also orders a comprehensive review of U.S. participation and support for all international organizations to ensure they serve U.S. interests.
potential_concerns: Withdrawing funding and participation may reduce U.S. influence within the United Nations and international bodies.
Cutting support to UNRWA could negatively impact Palestinian refugees reliant on its humanitarian services.
The broad review of all international organizations may delay diplomatic engagements and complicate multilateral relations.
Labeling organizations as biased or infiltrated could deepen geopolitical tensions and increase anti-American sentiment.
Implementation might face legal or budgetary challenges, especially related to existing treaty obligations and funding appropriations.
